slider.label: Number of Candidates
slider.info: Different number of candidates will lead to design of different voting rules

slider.label: Group Ratio
slider.info: Group fairness is computed in terms of group sizes, please enter ratio between the sizes of two groups as (smaller group size)/(larger group size)

slider.label: Group Fairness
slider.info: Real number between 0~1. Average group-imbalance based fairness value. Calculated using average rank utility of both groups. Higher value means more fairness.

slider.label: Condorcet Efficiency
slider.info: Real number between 0~1. Fraction of preference profiles where Condorcet winner is chosen if it exists. Higher value means more probability of choosing the Condorcet winner.

radio.label: Privacy Requirement
radio.info: To design a locally differential private mechanism, noise is added to each voterâ€™s vote. High privacy requirement causes higher noise, low privacy requirement causes lower noise.
